Description: Fragment of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Oval handle to sharp turn. Circular stamp with rose symbol. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip.
Production date: 199 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Probably drawn by Petrie (Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p.101a, 58). Name Pausanias. Likely to be from the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 361.19.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0965)
